| Section3 = {{Chembox Hazards SPhrases = ,

}} }} 'Proline' (abbreviated as 'Pro' or 'P') is an Î±-amino acid, one of the
twenty DNA-encoded amino acids. Its codons are CCU, CCC, CCA, and CCG. It is not
an essential amino acid, which means that the human body can synthesize it. It
is unique among the 20 protein-forming amino acids in that the amine nitrogen is
bound to not one but two alkyl groups, thus making it a secondary amine. The
more common L form has S stereochemistry.
